result.execSummary:
The defendant Noland Wheelan Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED.
The Court waives all costs and surcharges. Defendant is indigent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noland Wheelan Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 53 days TIME SERVED.
THE COURT waives all costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parites are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

On motion of the State the Court will DISMISS the Repeater portion of the charge.
Letter of correspondence from defendant, recieved and filed.
COURT ORDERED THE DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR PURPOSES OF A PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction (HOC) for purposes of this hearing.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Robert J Hampton appearing for attorney Mark Dluzak in court, Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart- N 124th St.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. No bail forfeited.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencinghhearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense newly appointed. Have not received discovery or an offer. COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court. Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appearing via telephone.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Defendant failed to appear this morning. Defendant now in court. Court reinstates bail previously forfeited. Case is calendared for status on 08/02/2016 at 01:30 pm, Branch 45.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to the Honorable Jean Kies, Branch 45 in Room 615 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 350.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report, dated 07/20/2016 received and filed. LNR
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart N. 124th Street.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk;  BN
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
Justice Point Program Discharge Summary report dated January 20, 2016; received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program Discharge Summary report dated January 20, 2016; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program violation report: Missed Office Contact; received and filed. Court and state reviewed violation and takes no action at this time. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court orders $100.00 cash bail be converted into a $100.00 signature bond. All previously ordered terms and conditions remain same.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status of counsel. Defense requests more time to review case.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court on August 19, 2015.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference on August 20, 2015. For reasons stated on the record as to defense unavailability and defendant's Justice Point Program violation.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37 on August 20, 2015 at 1:30. Upon defendant's appearance case will be set for bail bond hearing to address Justice Point Program violation.
Justice Point Program Discharge Summary report dated July 29, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court prior to case being called, defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference in the a.m., however counsel wasn't aware client was in custody.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court, in custody in Waukesha County Jail.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests the bench warrant lifted. GRANTED.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a pre-trial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Noland Wheelan Clark not in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/21/15 @ 1:30pm
